body.note: The WebHelp Classic Mobile system was deprecated as of version 19.0. It is recommended that you use the more recent WebHelp Responsive system for a flexible mobile variant.
body.p: WebHelp is a form of online help that consists of a series of web pages (XHTML format). Its advantages include platform independence, ability to update content continuously, and it can be viewed using a regular web browser. The WebHelp system includes several variants to suit your specific needs. The WebHelp Classic Mobile variant works on multiple platforms (Android, iOS, BlackBerry, Windows Mobile) and is specially designed for mobile devices when feedback from users is not necessary. It is available for DocBook and DITA document types. The functionality of the desktop WebHelp Classic layout is preserved, it is organized in an intuitive layout, and offers table of contents, search capabilities, and index navigation.
